The American Blood Supply
Arterial blood supply of the normal human pituitary gland
items.abstract: <jats:p content-type="fine-print">✓ A technique for the removal of sphenoid blocks from cadavers and for selective injection of the hypophyseal arteries of these specimens is described. Results of such injections are presented, with emphasis on the role of the inferior hypophyseal artery (IHA). The IHA was found to be the most important artery supplying the pituitary gland, and in particular, the structures involved in production, transportation, and storage of the antidiuretic hormone. The literature pertinent to the arterial blood supply of the normal pituitary gland is reviewed.</jats:p>

title: Agricultural Products: Demand, Supply, Prices

Chatter Vibration of Lathe Tools. Part 2: On the Mechanism of Exciting Energy Supply
items.abstract: <jats:p>First, the development of the chatter vibration is observed using several turning tools having various cutting edge configurations and in the conditions in which there are different levels of interference between the flank of the tool and the workpiece. Next, the exciting energy provided by the contact of tool flank and workpiece is calculated using an interference model at the tool flank which includes an elastic deformation of workpiece. This theoretical result agrees qualitatively with the experimental result concerning the development of chatter vibration. The energy-supplying mechanism in primary chatter vibration of a turning tool is clarified by examining the foregoing results collectively.</jats:p>

Plant growth in response to CO² enrichment, at two levels of nitrogen and phosphorus supply. 1. Dry matter, leaf area and development.
items.abstract: <jats:p>The effect on plant growth of doubling the normal aerial CO2 content was studied in lucerne, faba bean, perennial ryegrass, wheat, maize, poplar and potato. Because nutrients often limit growth, the effect of CO2 under N or P shortage was also studied. Doubling CO2 had the largest effect on DM yield with a good nutrient supply, but with N shortage part of the CO2 effect was retained even in non-leguminous spp. Except for faba bean, no CO2 effect existed with P shortage. Maize showed a small positive CO2 reaction under good nutrient supply but a negative one with nutrient shortage. Potato showed a small negative reaction to CO2 enrichment. (Abstract retrieved from CAB Abstracts by CABI’s permission)</jats:p>

The Effect of Shading and Nutrient Supply on Variegation and Nutrient Content of Variegated Cultivars of Peperomia obtusifolia
container-title: Journal of the American Society for Horticultural Science
items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
<jats:p>A reduction in light intensity by 27%, 47%, or 73% shading significantly increased percent variegation (relative amount of nongreen area per leaf) and significantly decreased fresh and dry weight, but did not appreciably affect leaf nutrient content of <jats:italic>Peperomia obtusifolia</jats:italic> L. Nutrient treatments had no consistent effect on variegation or fresh and dry weight.</jats:p>

title: The professionals: Experts are in short supply: Who will design and maintain future factories? A new breed of engineer is needed. Academia and industry seek new avenues for the necessary training
AMINO ACIDS IN PARENTERAL NUTRITION OF PRETERM INFANTS
items.abstract: <jats:p><jats:bold>ABSTRACT. </jats:bold> Parenteral feeding of preterm infants has been accepted as an alternative form of nutrition in those infants unable to accept oral feeding. The amount of amino acid nitrogen and the composition of the amino acid solution to be used, however, have not yet been defined. The amino acid intake and the plasma amino acid concentration of three groups of preterm infants were compared. Twenty‐three infants were fed parenterally. Of these, 16 were studied during the first week of life (group I) and 7 during the second week (group II). A control group of 9 infants fed with oral formula was also studied in the second week (group III). In general, plasma amino acid concentrations in the parenterally fed groups were higher than in the orally fed group, in spite of a lower intake. Comparison of the amino acid intake of groups I and II relative to group III, with the plasma amino acid concentrations of groups I and II relative to group III, revealed a rather constant ratio with the exception of tyrosine and aspartic acid, where higher values were found. It is concluded that further increase in the amino acid nitrogen in parenteral feeding of preterm infants requires a more adapted preparation.</jats:p>

title: The influence of an extra supply of iron on some blood components and on meat colour at slaughter in fattening veal calves
items.abstract: <jats:sec><jats:title>Summary</jats:title><jats:p>The effect of adding 5 ppm iron to a commercial milk replacer on food conversion, colour of the meat at slaughter, blood haemoglobin concentration, red blood cell count, plasma iron concentration and total plasma iron binding capacity in 2 sets of veal calves throughout the whole fattening period was studied.</jats:p><jats:p>The results show that extra iron in the diet of veal calves influenced the colour of the meat at slaughter in a negative way, whereas food conversion was influenced positively. During the last 3 weeks of the fattening period the extra iron in the diet led to an increased plasma iron concentration but not to an increase of blood haemoglobin concentration.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Zusammenfassung</jats:title><jats:p>Einfluß einer zusätzlichen Eisenverabreichung bei Mastkälbern auf einige Blutbestandteile und auf die Fleischfarbe bei der Schlachtung</jats:p><jats:p>Bei zwei Gruppen von Mastkälbern wurden während der gesamten Mastperiode 5 ppm Eisen einem kommerziellen Milchaustauscher hinzugefügt. Folgende Kriterien wurden ausgewertet: Futterverwertung, Farbe des Fleisches bei der Schlachtung, Blut‐Hämoglobinkonzentration, Erythrozytenzahl, Plasma‐Eisenkonzentration und Gesamtbindungskapazität für Eisen.</jats:p><jats:p>Die zusätzliche Eisenverabreichung beeinträchtigte die Fleischfarbe, wirkte sich aber positiv auf die Futterverwertung aus. Während der letzten 3 Mastwochen führte die Eisensupplementierung zu einer Zunahme der Plasma‐Eisenkonzentration, jedoch nicht zu einem Anstieg der Bluthämoglobinkonzentration.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Résumé</jats:title><jats:p>Influence d'une supplémentation en fer sur quelques paramètres sanguins et sur la coloration de la viande à l'abattage chez des veaux d'engrais</jats:p><jats:p>On a ajouté 5 ppm de fer dans un automate à lait du commerce durant toute la période de l'engraissement chez deux groupes de veaux à l'engrais. Les paramètres suivants ont été examinés: consommation, couleur de la viande à l'abattage, concentration de l'hémoglobine sanguine, nombre des érythrocytes, concentration du fer dans le plasma et capacité de liaison totale pour le fer.</jats:p><jats:p>La supplémentation en fer a influencé la coloration de la viande et a agi de façon positive sur la consommation. L'apport de fer a provoqué une augmentation de la concentration du fer dans le plasma mais pas une augmentation de la concentration de l'hémoglobine dans le sang.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Resumen</jats:title><jats:p>El influjo de un suplemento extra de hierro en terneros de engorde sobre algunos componentes de la sangre y sobre el color de la carne en el momento del faenamiento</jats:p><jats:p>En dos grupos de terneros de engorde se añadieron durante todo el periodo de cebo 5 ppm de hierro a un reemplazador comercial de la leche. Se evaluaron los criterios siguientes: conversión del pienso, color de la carne durante el faenamiento, concentración de hemoglobina en sangre, cantidad de eritrocitos, concentración de hierro en el plasma y capacidad de fijación total del hierro en el plasma.</jats:p><jats:p>El hierro aditivo en la dieta de los terneros influía de una manera negativa sobre el color de la carne en el momento del sacrificio, mientras que ejercía un influjo positivo sobre la conversión del pienso. Durante las 3 semanas de engorde últimas, el suplemento de hierro conducía a un aumento de la concentración de hierro en el plasma, pero no a un incremento de la concentración de hemoglobina en la sangre.</jats:p></jats:sec>
